extendedIngredients.name: strawberry preserves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup strawberry preserves (I used store bought)

recipes.title: Vanilla Cupcakes with Strawberry Filling and Strawberry Buttercream

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are my top picks for Cupcakes. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: Very aromatic with notes of hazelnut, vanilla, and a touch of oak followed by sweet raisins and a touch of yeast. Clean lasting finish. Good now but will reward those allow it to age"". A favorite pre-prandial beverage. Consider it with nuts before dinner as an aperitif, or after dinner with dessert, especially chocolates and fruit-based desserts. Also wonderful on cold afternoons, served with biscotti to dip in ""Italian-style"". "

recipes.instructions: For the cake, whisk together the egg whites, vanilla paste and 1/4 cup of the milk in small bowl until slightly combined. Set aside.In mixing bowl, beat butter and sugar for 2 minutes on medium. Add in dry ingredients and mix until combined. Slowly in a steady stream add in the egg white mixture. Beat in remaining milk.Fill cupcake liners half full with batter and bake in a 350 degree oven for about 15 minutes. Remove and cool in pan 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack. Cool completely before frosting.Using a piping bag with a small star tip, filled with the 1 cup of preserves, squeeze into tops of cupcakes. I pressed the tip into the center of each cupcakes then gave enough pressure until I saw the cupcake bubble a little bit. You can also use a cupcake plunger if you choose.For the frosting, beat butter for 3 minutes, until pale in color. Add cream, powdered sugar and preserves, beat an additional 3-5 minutes until fluffy. I used Tip 6S for my cupcakes. You can add sprinkles too, if desired. ENJOY.

steps.step: For the cake, whisk together the egg whites, vanilla paste and 1/4 cup of the milk in small bowl until slightly combined. Set aside.In mixing bowl, beat butter and sugar for 2 minutes on medium.

Add in dry ingredients and mix until combined. Slowly in a steady stream add in the egg white mixture. Beat in remaining milk.Fill cupcake liners half full with batter and bake in a 350 degree oven for about 15 minutes.

Remove and cool in pan 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack. Cool completely before frosting.Using a piping bag with a small star tip, filled with the 1 cup of preserves, squeeze into tops of cupcakes. I pressed the tip into the center of each cupcakes then gave enough pressure until I saw the cupcake bubble a little bit. You can also use a cupcake plunger if you choose.For the frosting, beat butter for 3 minutes, until pale in color.
Add cream, powdered sugar and preserves, beat an additional 3-5 minutes until fluffy. I used Tip 6S for my cupcakes. You can add sprinkles too, if desired. ENJOY.
